quizzes.question:
Define a progress bar that shows 63 percent of progress:
[!raw!]
<{0}
   min="0"
   max="100"
   {1}="{2}">
</progress>
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Progress Bar[/h1]

The [b]<progress>[/b] element provides the ability to create progress bars on the web.
The progress element can be used within headings, paragraphs, or anywhere else in the body.

[u][b]Progress Element Attributes[/b][/u]
[b]Value[/b]: Specifies how much of the task has been completed. 
[b]Max[/b]: Specifies how much work the task requires in total.

[b]Example: [/b] [code format="html" codeId="47"]Status: <progress min="0" [b]max[/b]="100" [b]value[/b]="35">
[b]</progress>[/b][/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2548" width="100%"]
[note]Use the <progress> tag in conjunction with JavaScript to dynamically display a task's progress.[/note]
